info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:07PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Elbert and southwestern Abbeville Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 707 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Elberton, or near Middleton, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elberton, Calhoun Falls, Lowndesville, Lake Strom Thurmond, Russell State Park, Middleton, Lake Russell, Rice Town, Ruckersville and Richard B Russell Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
